name: Hotel Premier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, booking on the website was a terrible idea, they can check you
reviews.title: Sleep in your car, but dont park in this lot!!!
OK For Football Games
reviews.text: in for much cheaper. The bathroom looked like something from a horror

movie, beat up and nasty. The front desk people were terrible. No help at all. The "manager" Christinia gave me an attitude when I asked for help, and gave me no answers. The hotel really is in the ghetto. At night, you are able to watch people getting followed on the streets, as well as drug deals. Great view. Truthfully, it is not
reviews.title: do not go there at all

reviews.text: close to the stadium. And walking at night to and from the hotel is like asking to be mugged and raped. So if thats what you like, stay here.
reviews.title: Not Happy

reviews.text: My 5 yr old son and I stayed here to crash after a Titans night game. It was perfectly acceptable. I read the awful reviews, yet still felt we needed to stay near the stadium to avoid parking hassles. I can only speak for our double-bed, non-smkg room (#518) - which was clean and cool. The shower obviously wasn't brand new, but everything else in the room seemed to work well. The indoor pool was fine too. The walk to/from the stadium was not bad at all - seeing as it was a gameday and there were people & police presence everywhere. I felt safe even on the walk back to the hotel after 11:00 pm. Other than that - if you're looking to walk out your hotel door and get to downtown or Broadway, nightlife, etc., I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Those places are too far to walk; the only way I would stay here again would be for a football game or other event at the stadium.
reviews.title: Old and Dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not what I expected. The area was not the best, there were homeless people around. That was not a big deal to me but just bringing it up. The hotel itself just seemed old and cheap. And the funny thing was it said "newly renovated"
reviews.title: worn out and cheap

reviews.text: Maybe it was just our room but the worst thing was the bathroom. It was like this old hot tub that was converted into a shower. The jets were sealed up and it was so tall you had to have supermodel legs to get into it. My wife cut her toe getting out of it. The TV was super small, I believe 19 in, I have never seen a TV that small in a hotel before, was not a big deal for us because we did not use it, but just saying. And for me the free breakfast was a joke. The waffle was terrible, I don't know if it was the waffle or the syrup but it was gross. And the Orange Juice was so watered down, no taste at all. Beds were very hard as well.
reviews.title: stay away at all cost

reviews.text: The good things though were it had a nice indoor pool, and it was quiet though I don't think the place was anywhere near capacity. And despite it being a bad area the actual location was good. I would recommend it to anyone going to a football game because the stadium is very close and parking is free at the hotel.
reviews.title: Worn around the edges, but not a bad place

likes.disliked: — The beds were a little too squishy.

reviews.title: area to be avoided at all costs
reviews.text: First, the bathroom.My son attempted to take a shower.The hot water would not come on. The hot and cold were backwards and it took 15 minutes for the hot water to get to the room. The faucet on the tub had been smashed into the wall. Instead of replacing the broken tile, it was left smashed into the wall with approx two tubes of caulk applied around it. The room itself was hideous. The furniture had been broken and placed back together. Two of the pillows were torn with the stuffing hanging out.The sprinkler system thet they have added in the hallways is hillarious. They made a box of wood that runs the upper ceiling/wall that covers part of the room doors. The entrance to the hotel has been done nicely to decieve you. The minute you get off the elevator you will be shocked. The heated pool was under "maintance" as the sign read. When it finally opened, it was ice cold. They placed a liner in it. It was done badly. You can feel the pockets of air under the liner. It is kind of creepy. The part of town it is in is just scary. I feared that my car would be broken into. The night shift desk guy parked his car in front of the entrance so he could watch it from his position at the desk, and his car was a piece of crap. We did get out of there with our lives and without any damage to our vehicle. I Thank God for watching over us. I should have researched better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A buddy and I stayed here on a weekend trip to Nashville. The room was dirt cheap, and knowing that it was in an industrial area, we were a little wary. We were in town before check-in and asked a police officer about the hotel. He told us that some of the nearby hotels are sketchy, pay by the hour types, but this one is ok. Turns out, he was right.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.text: Wow! If we had read these reviews first there's no way my husband and I would have stayed here with our children. We were passing through Nashville on a very long car trip. My husband picked this hotel based on its heated indoor pool. Not only was the pool not heated, it had some kind of oil slick on the surface. The room was very delapitated as the other reviewers said, the carpet and furniture in need of replacing, and the towels and linens thin and greyish. It could be a nice hotel, but it needs A LOT of work. Really the only thing I could say was nice was the front desk staff. Were we ever in Nashville again I can assure you we will not be staying here!
reviews.title: You really don't want to stay here

reviews.text: At one time this was a nice hotel I'm sure, but it is in a delapidated section of town. We actually watched a stabbing from our hotel room on Saturday afternoon and my husband called 911 to report it. It was like watching "COPS". The hotel was run down and unkept. The front desk people were nice, and the shower water pressure and temperature were good, but other than that, I would not recommended this hotel to anyone. From our friend's room across the hall we had a nice view of a homeless campsite. The continental breakfast was not good. cereal and milk, ran out of coffee, no attendant wiping up or refreshing anything, a few muffins and bagels you could toast. I will be staying in town the next trip to Nashville.
reviews.title: Slum Area of Nashville Beware

likes.liked: — Water pressure. Courteous at front desk/Taxifare to downtown not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay elswhere.
reviews.title: SLEEP IN YOUR CAR!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, this property is NOT downtown but in the ghetto across the river. While we were there, there was a six hour hostage standoff at the motel across the street and the liquor store two blocks away, which the hotel recommended for beer purchase, was busted for selling crack and paraphenalia. The hotel itself was run down, dirty and broken. We had to move three times to find a room that was even tolerable. We ended up in what the hotel called their "best room" in which the toilet ran 24/7 and there were broken light fixtures. The hotel is close to the stadium, but do not walk alone. The hotel is also very noisy.
reviews.title: Pretty Bad

reviews.text: There were a couple of good qualities. The view of downtown from our room was nice and the on site lounge was a plus. The best feature of this hotel is the front desk staff. They were extremely nice and helpful and deserve to work at a better property. I felt bad for them having to represent such a dump. They deserve much better.
reviews.title: filthy, gross and pathetic

likes.liked: — my brother paid for my room and there was parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early evening and were advised not to walk anywhere due to the street walkers. Th hotel is next to s truck stop and we did not feel safe at all. The room was dirty and we did not sleep as we could not stop scratching. Tried to take a bath but it was filthy. Save yourself the heartache and stay away.
reviews.title: disgusting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has several problems.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: 1) It is old and dirty. The carpet is dirty, the door does not fit the frame, the bathroom tub is dirty. We can hear the neighbor talking clearly.
reviews.title: Disgusting!

reviews.text: 2) There is a railway station next to it and it is noisy at night.
reviews.title: Night at the museum

likes.disliked: — The pubic hair all over the room (bed, bathroom, etc.)

reviews.text: 3) The wireless does not work, although it is advertised that they have free wireless Internet
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

aka: Days Inn Downtown / At The Stadium Hotel
description: The Hotel Premier is formerly the Days Inn Nashville Stadium. The hotel is currently rebranding to become the very first Best Western Premier in TN.The hotel has 180 newly remodeled and decorated rooms. The lobby area is currently being renovated to better serve your needs.The hotel is located north of LP Field "Home to the TN Titans"
